t: “Come,*pn everyone who thirsts, come*ld to the waters; and*ln he who has no money, come,*ld buy and eat! Come,*ln buy wine and milk without*ld money and without price.

Why*ln do you spend your money for that which is not bread, and*ld your labor for that which does not satisfy? Listen*ln diligently to me, and eat what is good, and*ld delight yourselves in rich food.
Incline*ln your ear, and come to me; hear,*ld that your soul may live; and*ln I will make with you an everlasting covenant, my*ld steadfast, sure love for David.
Behold,*ln I made him a witness to the peoples, a*ld leader and commander for the peoples.

Behold,*ln you shall call a nation that you do not know, and*ld a nation that did not know you shall run to you, because*ln of the Lord*s your God, and of the Holy One of Israel, for*ld he has glorified you.
“Seek*pn the Lord*s while he may be found; call*ld upon him while he is near;
let*ln the wicked forsake his way, and*ld the unrighteous man his thoughts; let*ln him return to the Lord,*s that he may have compassion on him, and*ld to our God, for he will abundantly pardon.
For*ln my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither*ld are your ways my ways, declares the Lord.*s
For*ln as the heavens are higher than the earth, so*ld are my ways higher than your ways and*ld my thoughts than your thoughts.
“For*pn as the rain and the snow come down from heaven and*ld do not return there but water the earth, making*ln it bring forth and sprout, giving*ld seed to the sower and bread to the eater,
so*ln shall my word be that goes out from my mouth; it*ld shall not return to me empty, but*ln it shall accomplish that which I purpose, and*ld shall succeed in the thing for which I sent it.
“For*pn you shall go out in joy and*ld be led forth in peace; the*ln mountains and the hills before you shall*ld break forth into singing, and*ld all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
Instead*ln of the thorn shall come up the cypress; instead*ld of the brier shall come up the myrtle; and*ln it shall make a name for the Lord,*s an*ld everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.”
